sentence.Network_en: A stalagmite is below a stalactite and they both grow, eventually to meet.
sentence.Network_cn: 石笋在钟乳石下面,它们二者都在增长, 最终会合.

sentence.Network_en: It takes thousands of years to form a stalactite cave.
sentence.Network_cn: 龙洞的形成,要经历上千年的时间.

sentence.Network_en: The nose is a manifest congealed drop or stalactite.
sentence.Network_cn: 鼻子,很明显,是一个凝聚了的水滴,或钟乳石.

PerfectNetExp.abs: ...钟乳石（stalactite）对远古地质考察有着重要的研究价值。 　广西、云南是我国钟乳石（stalactite）资源最丰富的省区，所产的钟乳石（stalactite）光泽剔透、形状奇特，具有很高的欣赏价值。碧野《富春江畔·“冰壶”与“双龙”》：“洞内到处都是钟乳石（stalactite），湿润清新，有的像玉柱从顶垂直到地，有的像雨云倒悬空中，有的像白浪滔滔，波涌连天，真是气象万千，蔚为奇观.
An extract from The Adventures... ... lit up:v. 点火(点灯,变快活) stalactites:n. 石钟乳 walk around:vt. 游荡(无目地行走).

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 17th cent.: from modern Latin stalactites, from Greek stalaktos 'dripping', based on stalassein 'to drip'

entry.def: A stalactite is a long piece of rock which hangs down from the roof of a cave. Stalactites are formed by the slow dropping of water containing the mineral lime.

means.word_mean: 1. a cylinder of calcium carbonate hanging from the roof of a limestone cave

auth_sentence.content: Tracey hammers stalactite statements on "Nicely Placed", as Parker staggers around, dropping and swooping.

auth_sentence.content: Cousteau's stalactite shows three growth stages, so it's a record of changing sea levels over time.

auth_sentence.content: Each of the rings represents a period of growth when the stalactite was exposed to air.
